intro: Acrostichum fasciculatum, commonly known as the dwarf hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is a small, perennial shrub native to the tropical regions of the Americas. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in wet, shady environments and is often found in marshy areas or along stream banks. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
